frege.runtime

Class Regex

  • java.lang.Object
    • frege.runtime.Regex

  • public final class Regex
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the home of the Matcher related functions referenced from frege.Prelude

    Most matcher operations implemented in Matcher change the state of the matcher instance. Therefore we can't use them directly in frege code.

    Instead, we provide here a re-implementation of the functionality we need. The idea is to make a copy of the matcher before the destructive operation, run the operation on the copy and return it to frege code. This is safe because there is no reference to the copy before the operation in frege code.

    As a consequence, matcher operations like Matcher.find() or Matcher.matches() that return boolean in Java appear in Frege as function from Matcher to Matcher or Maybe Matcher, because the results (i.e. MatchResult.group()) cannot be retrieved from the quasi-immutable Matcher that was passed in.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public static java.util.regex.Matcher clone(java.util.regex.Matcher m)

        Copy a Matcher instance.

        This function relies on the fact that Matcher.toMatchResult() effectively makes a copy (yet an incomplete one) of the current matcher. It completes the copy by invoking Matcher.usePattern(java.util.regex.Pattern) which sets up the internal arrays.

        The copy can not be used to retrieve information about the last match operation of the original matcher.

        Parameters:
        m - the Matcher to copy
        Returns:
        a copy of a matcher
